function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of shared badges by multiple patients can lead to indirect contact and potential transmission of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Spread of contagious diseases within the patient population and to the employees.","Mitigation":"Implement a system of regular sanitation and disinfection of the badges between uses, or switch to a non-contact method of data transmission.","Technologies":"Non-contact data transmission technologies such as Bluetooth or RFID can be used to eliminate the need for shared badges.","People":"Patients, employees","Owner":"Healthcare facility management"},{"Description":"Proximity-based data transfer through NFC technology can lead to the spread of contagious diseases if the smartphones and badges are not properly sanitized.","Impact":"Potential transmission of diseases between employees and patients through shared smartphones and badges.","Mitigation":"Enforce regular cleaning and disinfection of smartphones and badges, provide guidelines for proper hygiene practices when using the devices.","Technologies":"Antimicrobial phone cases, UV sterilization devices for smartphones, and self-disinfecting surfaces for badges can be used to reduce the risk of transmission.","People":"Patients, employees","Owner":"Healthcare facility management"},{"Description":"Lack of visibility into the number of patients and their contact with the badges increases the difficulty of contact tracing and containment of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Inability to effectively track and isolate potential disease carriers, leading to uncontrolled spread within the facility.","Mitigation":"Implement a system to track badge usage and monitor patient interactions, deploy contact tracing technology to identify potential exposure, establish clear protocols for isolation and testing of individuals in contact with badges.","Technologies":"Real-time badge tracking systems, contact tracing apps, and RFID technology for monitoring patient movement can enhance visibility and enable timely intervention.","People":"Patients, employees","Owner":"Healthcare facility management"}]}
